name: Longganisa
description: Longganisa is the Filipino version of a sausage, typically served for breakfast with garlic rice and eggs (Longsilog). Regional variations exist across the Philippines: 'Hamonado' versions are sweet and red (common in Pampanga), while 'Derecado' versions are garlicky, spicy, and vinegar-heavy (common in Vigan and Lucban).
